headline: Democratic U.S. Senate candidate Alex Lasry pours in $1.55 million more into race, while Sarah Godlewski adds $750,000
author: Bill Glauber
sentences: Lasry, on leave from his executive job with the Milwaukee Bucks, poured in another $1.55 million into the race during the final three months of 2021, while Godlewski added another $750,000, their campaigns said Monday.

With Republican U.S. Sen. Ron Johnson entering the race for a third term, Democrats in a crowded primary field are increasingly eager to show they have the fundraising muscle for the lengthy and expensive campaign.

Godlewski's campaign said: "Ron Johnson and the Republican political machine will unleash an avalanche of right-wing special-interest cash to smear Democrats and spread lies to the people of Wisconsin.
Mandela Barnes' campaign previously reported raising $1.23 million in the quarter and has raised $2.3 million since the candidate entered the race, with much of it coming from small-dollar donors.
We have received contributions from every corner of Wisconsin, raised more money than any other campaign in the Democratic primary, and I have invested in my campaign as well."
During last year's fourth quarter the Lasry campaign raised $473,000 and has now taken in $2.8 million, the highest total among the Democratic front-runners.
With the contributions  and the Lasry cash  the campaign had total receipts of $5.1 million last year and ended December with $1.12 million cash on hand.
Besides Godlewski's big check, her campaign raised around $360,000 more from donations last quarter and ended December with $1.3 million cash on hand.
Democrats Alex Lasry and Sarah Godlewski aren't completely self-funding their campaigns for U.S. Senate, but they're each throwing in a lot of cash.
Overall, Lasry has loaned $2.35 million to his campaign since entering the race while Godlewski, the state treasurer, has put in $1.795 million.
Stephen Olikara raised $110,000 during the last three months of 2021 and had $108,000 cash on hand, according to his public filing.
I've said from the beginning that this campaign will have the resources necessary to beat Ron Johnson,? Lasry said in a statement.
Outagamie County Executive Tom Nelson reported raising $215,522 in the fourth quarter and finished with $484,372 cash on hand.
Sarah knows we can't be outgunned in this election, and she's making sure her campaign has the resources needed to win."
The campaign had nearly $1.1 million cash on hand at the end of December, according to a federal filing.
Johnson reported raising $711,000 during the fourth quarter and ended with $2.4 million cash on hand.
Since January of 2017 Johnson has raised more than $5 million, according to campaign filings.
The big bucks from multimillionaires Lasry and Godlewski didn't come as a huge surprise.
Over the past year, we have built a statewide team to do just that.
Overall, Nelson has raised $1.15 million since entering the race.
The Lasry campaign also went up with significant TV ad buys.
The primary is Aug. 9 with the general election Nov. 8.
They have both promised to "invest" in their races.
